verses.verse: Why are times<WH6256> not laid up<WH6845> by the Almighty<WH7706>? And why do not they that know<WH3045> him see<WH2372> his days<WH3117>?
There are that remove<WH5381> the landmarks<WH1367>; They violently take away<WH1497> flocks<WH5739>, and feed them<WH7462>.
They drive away<WH5090> the ass<WH2543> of the fatherless<WH3490>; They take<WH2254> the widow<WH490>'s ox<WH7794> for a pledge<WH2254>.
They turn<WH5186> the needy<WH34> out of the way<WH1870>: The poor<WH6041> of the earth<WH776> all<WH3162> hide themselves<WH2244>.

Behold <WH6501>, as wild asses in the desert<WH4057> They go forth<WH3318> to their work<WH6467>, seeking diligently<WH7836> for food<WH2964>; The wilderness<WH6160> yieldeth them bread<WH3899> for their children<WH5288>.
They cut<WH7114> their provender<WH1098> in the field<WH7704>; And they glean<WH3953> the vintage<WH3754> of the wicked<WH7563>.
They lie all night<WH3885> naked<WH6174> without clothing<WH3830>, And have no covering<WH3682> in the cold<WH7135>.
They are wet<WH7372> with the showers<WH2230> of the mountains<WH2022>, And embrace<WH2263> the rock<WH6697> for want of a shelter<WH4268>.
There are that pluck<WH1497> the fatherless<WH3490> from the breast<WH7699>, And take a pledge<WH2254> of the poor<WH6041>;
So that they go<WH1980> about naked<WH6174> without clothing<WH3830>, And being hungry<WH7457> they carry<WH5375> the sheaves<WH6016>.
They make oil<WH6671> within<WH996> the walls<WH7791> of these men<WH1869>; They tread their winepresses<WH3342>, and suffer thirst<WH6770>.
From out of the populous city<WH5892> men<WH4962> groan<WH5008>, And the soul<WH5315> of the wounded<WH2491> crieth out<WH7768>: Yet God<WH433> regardeth<WH7760> not the folly<WH8604>.
These are of them that rebel<WH4775> against the light<WH216>; They know<WH5234> not the ways<WH1870> thereof<WH3427>, Nor abide in the paths thereof<WH5410>.
The murderer<WH7523> riseth<WH6965> with the light<WH216>; He killeth<WH6991> the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH6041>; And in the night<WH3915> he is as a thief<WH1590>.
The eye<WH5869> also of the adulterer<WH5003> waiteth<WH8104> for the twilight<WH5399>, Saying<WH559>, No eye<WH5869> shall see<WH7789> me<WH5643>: And he disguiseth his face<WH6440>.
In the dark<WH2822> they dig through<WH2864> houses<WH1004>: They shut<WH2856> themselves up in the day-time<WH3119>; They know<WH3045> not the light<WH216>.
For the morning<WH1242> is to all of them as<WH3162> thick darkness<WH6757>; For they know<WH5234> the terrors<WH1091> of the thick darkness<WH6757>.
Swiftly they pass away<WH7031> upon the face of the waters<WH6440>; Their portion<WH2513> is cursed<WH7043> in the earth<WH776>: They turn<WH6437> not into the way<WH1870> of the vineyards<WH3754>.
Drought <WH6723> and heat<WH2527> consume<WH1497> the snow<WH7950> waters<WH4325>: So doth Sheol<WH7585> those that have sinned<WH2398>.

The womb<WH7358> shall forget<WH7911> him<WH7415>; The worm shall feed sweetly<WH4988> on him<WH2142>; He shall be no more remembered; And unrighteousness<WH5766> shall be broken<WH7665> as a tree<WH6086>.
He devoureth<WH7462> the barren<WH6135> that beareth<WH3205> not<WH3190>, And doeth not good to the widow<WH490>.
Yet God preserveth<WH4900> the mighty<WH47> by his power<WH3581>: He riseth up<WH6965> that hath no assurance<WH539> of life<WH2416>.
God giveth<WH5414> them to be in security<WH983>, and they rest<WH8172> thereon<WH5869>; And his eyes are upon their ways<WH1870>.

They are exalted<WH7426>; yet a little while<WH4592>, and they are gone<WH4355>; Yea, they are brought low, they are taken out<WH7092> of the way<WH1870> as all others<WH5243>, And are cut off as the tops<WH7218> of the ears of grain<WH7641>.
And if it be not so now<WH645>, who will prove<WH7760> me a liar<WH3576>, And make<WH7760> my speech<WH4405> nothing worth<WH408>?
